```
Brave New World
Chapter 1
Page 1

In the first chapter of Brave New World, the reader is introduced to the concept of the World State, a futuristic society in which human beings are bred and conditioned to fulfill specific societal roles. The chapter opens with a description of the Central London Hatchery and Conditioning Centre, a building where human beings are produced in test tubes and raised in incubators. The Director of the Hatchery takes a group of students on a tour of the facility, explaining the process by which the society's citizens are created and conditioned to fulfill their predetermined roles. The chapter ends with the Director leading the students into the Fertilizing Room,
```
